description: {"blocks":[{"key":"unv0","text":"This protocol is for dA-tailing, which is an enzymatic method for adding a non-templated nucleotide to the 3' end of a blunt, double-stranded DNA molecule. In other words, this puts A-chains on the end of our PCR product, creating a site for the ligation adapter to attach to. Simple process - create a reaction with three chemicals, cleanup the product with beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6soud","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u8h","text":"Time required: ~45 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dm07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ihnk","text":"The NEB protocol this is based on can be found here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":17}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"93CD14A1C09C11ED92D30A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/08/13/protocol-for-use-with-nebnext-ultra-ii-end-repair-da-tailing-module-e7546"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nl3p","text":"Place the tube back on the magnet for   or until the solution is clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bktn9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"2DA13050D8A311ECB2D87BFDB35A3B57","id":"82201","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cqkg","text":"Transfer the water containing the DNA to a new 1.5mL LoBind eppi tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97in5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9r1qk","text":"You should now have your A-tailed DNA template.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avmha","text":"If you have access to a Quantus or Qubit fluorometer, now is a good time to quantify the resulting amount of DNA in your purified sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"863aa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h165","text":"If not, the   /   of molecular water added above should put you in the ballpark of the right DNA concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fd5kr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2550d","text":"I typically have a concentration of 11-33 ng/uL at this point and used it at this level for the next step. No dilutions or adjustments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp2du","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"31","error":false,"guid":"1F0F9D60E67211EC8C56E1A1D416BB3A","id":"92438","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"61","error":false,"guid":"1CBC85A0E67211EC8C56E1A1D416BB3A","id":"92439","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n0s","text":"It is possible to break and store the sample at 4C overnight if needed. It would be ideal to continue on to adapter ligation at this time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: ONT dA-tailing for Fungal Barcoding
